The offices are overcrowded and record space is insufficient. Moreover the Indian Assistant's Court Room is now required for the Assistant Political Agent, 2 . Temporary arrangements have been made to remove the Indian Assistant's Court, Office and the Court records to a building, which has been rented not far from the Agency. His Excellency Shaikh .Hamad bin 'Isa, while willing with his usual courtesy, to agree to this arrange: -ment for a few months in order to assist us in cur difficulties said that he was not prepared to agree to the arrangement as a permanent measure because such a Court should be held in the Agency area for political reasons. Since the coining of the -Bahrain Petroleum Company it has become increasingly difficult to obtain suitable accommodation for clerks and ,the rents charged for such accommodation as is available have risen considerably. It is also desirable to have one clerk on the premises to attend to urgent business, which has much increased with the rapid development of Bahrain. physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 54; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 1-52; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: The file contains papers, mostly correspondence, relating to proposed additions and alterations to the Sepoys’ Barrack, within the grounds of the Political Agency compound in Bahrain, with a view to converting it into a Court and Office for the Indian Assistant.The correspondence is largely between the following: the Political Residency in the Persian Gulf, and the Political Agency, Bahrain; the Political Residency in the Persian Gulf, and the Government of India Foreign and Political Department; The Political Agent, Bahrain, and Charles Dalrymple Belgrave, Adviser to the Government of Bahrain.The file includes a blueprint site plan of the proposed Indian Assistant’s Court at Bahrain.
